Reviews.Title: “Nice but you are taking chances”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: I was there on March 24th. First impression was great. Small hotel, great loctaion. The service was excellent. However, the room I stayed was licking water from the ceeling. Otherwise, it was fine. I am learning that in Condado, Puerto Rico, with so called Boutique hotels you are taking chances. Next time, I will stay in well- knowed hotel. Maybe check around these small hotels before making any reservation.. There price differeces is not worth it to take chances.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but avoid first floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Roaming_Sean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after spending a week on Vieques. It's located in a great, walkable area full of bars and restaurants. The hotel has a nice pool and the staff was friendly. I found our room to be fairly basic and the bed wasn't very comfortable. The worst part was that we could hear everything from the lobby area - and we slept like crap because of it. They either need to install better doors to the rooms, add carpet or put a door between the lobby and the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Choose somewhere else - many better alternatives”
Reviews.Author: W C
Reviews.Content: Service - substandard. Room - adequate Complaints - air conditioner kept filling the room with smoke, setting off alarm; this apparently had been going on since long before we arrived. Bogus charges added to bill (Safe charges - never used the safe); "Surcharge Fee" -surcharge for what no one could explain; basically ripping of when ever they could. Antidote: choose another place; many better alternatives nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Le Consulat Revisited”
Reviews.Author: AquaBarb
Reviews.Content: When phoning to make my reservation they knew I had been there before and offered me the same room. I felt like family coming home. I referred others in our group since I found it affordable, well located, an overall pleasant experience on my prior stay and it did not disappoint. 8 of the 20 rooms in the small boutique hotel were occupied by those who heard of it based on my suggetion. I'll go again next time in San Juan and expect they will too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique Condado property”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: This place isn't fancy, but if you want to stay in Condado, it offers good value -- especially when redeeming Choice Privileges award points. It's an older building, art deco-ish. Rooms are a bit old fashioned, but we had Room 210 with the 2 queens and sofa bed which was quite spacious. Pool area small but pretty (waterfall pool). No breakfast, but tons of nearby eateries. In fact, this area is amazingly busy at all hours of the day and night, but the hotel was quiet (and will be quiet for you, so long as you get good neighbors!). Parking is a 5 minute walk and $5 charge. I'm not sure I'd want to stay for a longer resort-type stay, but if you're just visiting San Juan briefly for a cruise or exploration of the rest of the island, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “MAC BOOK PRO STOLEN OUT OF MY ROOM! DON'T STAY THERE”
Reviews.Author: Jermell S
Reviews.Content: The hotel personnel were extremely friendly and helpful initially. Then, I come back to my room after an extended day at the beach to find out that my laptop(MacBook Pro) has been stolen out of there. To add insult to injury, Estela, the front desk clerk working at the time, actually let someone in my room. She believed he was my friend so she let the guy in my room. This person(my "friend") was not authorized for entry, nor was he listed on the room. Just because she saw this guy with us, she thought it was "ok" to let him in the room. I file a police report, and the hotel sets up a "claim" with their insurance. Fast forward 3 weeks and I receive word from the insurance that the hotel does not have the coverage to even cover such a claim. I am still computer-less and now have to file a lawsuit against the hotel to be compensated for this ridiculous issue. If you love your personal items, and want to stay somewhere where they care when such terrible things happen, then I will not advise you to stay in this hotel. The hotel isn't being accountable for their SCREW UP of letting someone in my room. I have been getting the run-around to the utmost extreme; I am sure things will change after this lawsuit hits. Take Care.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value and service.”
Reviews.Author: JoshC87
Reviews.Content: San Juan and Puerto Rico as a whole have so much to see and experience that this hotel was perfect for my needs. We had a room on the first floor with a patio, unfortunately the firat night we had the notorious 112. This room is terrible! be forewarned, if they give you this room ask if you can be moved the next morning. That's what happened to us and after that everything was great. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, facilities clean, area was safe and in the middle of everything. It was a steal too! If you are on a budget, want to explore and we out while on vacation and just looking for a clean, friendly amd safe place to sleep inbetween adventures, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “One Can do Better”
Reviews.Author: HT_Man
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location near the corner where Magdalena meets Ashford. Hot water in bathroom. The remote for TV is given to you at the front desk. Cons: Very sparse room. Very uncomfortable bed that is hard, bouncy and squeeks. Phone did not work. AC outlets coming oiut of the walls. Section of ceiling over bed was covered with some acoustic tile taped on with masking tape and starting to sag. Seemed like the people above would end up in our bed at some point during the night. Had to borrow hair dryer from front desk. Noisy narrow hallway outside the rooms. They charge an extra $3 per day that you pay when you leave, not included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “you could pay more and get less”
Reviews.Author: sunbuns
Reviews.Content: we stayed @ la consulat both before and after our cruise allowing us a bit of extra time to see san juan.(don,t blow through san juan if you have xtra time,it is an amazing city with lots to see).after due diligence,we decided apon this site and we were happy with this hotel.it is nothing fancy(a little spartan),but the rooms are clean and we found the staff warm and helpful.the main reason we stayed here was the location(15 minutes to the airport,old san juan,and the cruise terminal plus 3 blocks to condado beach and restaurants and night life.)the area seemed safe(swarming with police)and there is a nice little pool out back to sit around and have your favorite beverage.our room came with a little deck. the comments about the shower temp. are valid(lukewarm the first day but hot the next?) the people we travelled with stayed @ the howard johnsons last time they were through and said they paid more and the place was falling apart.this place was not fancy but it was clean and safe. we booked it on priceline and got what we thouht to be a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A Great little Hotel in a Fantastic Location :)”
Reviews.Author: Alex259
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Le Consulat after a stressful delayed pair of flights from the UK and was immediately welcomed by the recptionist who had obviously stayed at his post waiting for our arrival. (24 hour receptions in small hotels are sometimes hard to come by!) Check in was smooth and immediately got the keys to the room. It was well past midnight and we were clearly shattered. The room itself was adequate. Very Clean, no real views to talk about but had everything we wanted, except for perhaps a minibar! We were told on arrival that we would need to pay for the safe if we used it, but that would be a minimal charge on checkout, but that was all fine. Air Con was amazing! very chilled in the room and even though we arrived in the rain, it was well received as we opened the door. Well the hotel itself doesnt have great amenities. yes it has a (tiny) pool, but why would you want to stay around that when the amazing condado beach is only 100metres away! Every sort of food is available within a ten minute walk so if you are craving a bit of American deep fried convenience or some traditional snacks then it is all laid out for you. Many bars also within a short stroll. Only 20 minutes on the bus for only 0.75dollars to old San Juan also - don't bother getting a cab for 20 dollars! All in all a great convenient hotel. Not 3 or 4 or 5 star - but perfect for what you get!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be MUCH better!”
Reviews.Author: x x
Reviews.Content: This is a cute small hotel but certainly does have its issues. I could not use my cell phone in the hotel at all as I never was able to get a signal. I have T-Mobile and the front desk girl insisited that she too had T-Mobile and she said it was fine. I see other people who reviewed had this issue also. the breakfast is pretty bad. Packaged type muffins you get at Walgreens. They could make it 100% better by puttig some effort into the breakfast and making some GREAT cookies or something. That way if it is something from the island then the guests will rave about them instead of grumbling about crappy pre packaged junk. (get my point???) The desk cleck was partying with her friends in the lobby one night whne I came home late. The front door was locked and I had to show ID to prove I was a guest. Smelled WEED being smoked on several occasions at night. Shower lacked hot water. TV is not able to get multiple cable stations like other hotels. Pool is small but ok. They could/should offer something to make people want to return to the place. It just ok for the price but for the same proice yo can stay at a better place. Stayed at the Radisson for about teh same on another trip and had a room with balcony and free breakfast buffet daily.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated and cost too much...”
Reviews.Author: chevelleskick
Reviews.Content: We arrived here and wasn't impressed. We had to wear our water sock in the room and shower being we didn't know how clean the room was. breakfast was terrible. We ended up down the street at the local donut shop. Rooms were very ran down and teh place needs to have a remodel done. They are very cheap even using an opened courtesy shampoo bottle filling it with water then reusing it for the next guest. We were offered nothing as a courtesy. What a bad way to start off our trip. Luckily we only stayed one night. We would pay a little more for a cleaner place and better atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but would have stayed else where.”
Reviews.Author: MsTiesha
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on July 22 for 2 nights. The room was on the Second floor. The room was small and awkward the TV was on the opposite side of the bed. Under the bathroom sink the board was broking. The shower drain hole was huge I hope no one drop an earring or ring down there or it would be gone forever . Phone service was absolutely nonexistent I have tmobile they do have free wifi. Pool area is small but nice. A cab to the hotel from the airport is $15.00 pretty reasonable but a ride back will run you $20.00. You have a Walgreen right around the corner to by your snacks because the hotel does not have any vending machine or fridge in the room as you exit the hotel to your right you will find restaurants and tuns of stores. Take a cab to Old San Juan and have dinner at Raices the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boutique Feel... Executive Suites~Under delivered”
Reviews.Author: sky_9
Reviews.Content: So let me get the worst out of the way first: I had two executive suites (1st floor both facing the pool area) and both did not provide WiFi, not even in the pool area. I stayed for a week (on business), so yes, it was very inconvenient. When the staff says "I don't know why those rooms NEVER receive signal..." and management does nothing to resolve the issue... I have to wonder. Cell phone signal was poor to non-existent if you have Tmobile; AT&T was fine. The showers.... WAO! Seriously, it was either freezing cold or boiling HOT HOT HOT HOT HOT Consistently switching from one extreme to the other... Not enjoyable at all. BTW, the water regulator does not help. It would have been nice, or perfect if the rooms had a mini-fridge; but I purchased a cooler and kept my drinks and snacks cold. The sofa-bed was old, dusty, not comfortable at all. Now for the good stuff: the rooms were clean, beds were very comfortable, the rooms were spacious, the staff~ very friendly. The pool was very nice, private, the water's temperature was right, I felt at home :) My kids loved it. Business wise... the post office is across the street. There's also a dry cleaners nearby. The location was perfect, in the middle of el Condado. Great restaurants within walking distances. Lots of places to shop, the beach is walking distance too. The night life at certain hotels (La Concha and Marriott) are great Thursdays-Sundays. If you have a car, you obviously have more options. But lots of places to eat: Budatai, il Postino, Cielito Lindo, Ropa Vieja, La Varita, to name a few. If you drive to Atlantica, they have the best Pulpo a la Gallega. Their seafood is great and fresh. You have to try El Hamburger in Old San Juan... A car is a must if you'd like to discover the island... I've visited PR a million times and it never gets old! :) Parking for the hotel is a bit far but you can pull over to unload and load. Breakfast: they always had black coffee (no milk, no creamers), and some danish for free. I didn't get to try it but it was a nice gesture. There was also a microwave at the lobby. Would I visit or recommend. Yes! But first I will ask if the showers have been fixed, and I will not go for business... not practical unless I have my own WiFi card, then I would not mind working from the near by beaches or even the pool. :)

Reviews.Title: “LOCATED WALKING DISTANCE FROM THE ACTION AND CASINOS ARE”
Reviews.Author: joann791
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my mom and sister, at first i was scared cause area looked lonely but soon saw it was nice to walk to place alot of people around close to casino , beach bus stops and great restaurants and pubs . i went on a cheap budget and things can get real expensive taxi wise and driving around is hectic , no one follows rules , so i took the bus to old San Juan 75 cents need exact change beach is one block away , the bed at this hotel has been the best bed in any hotel i have ever been in , front desk girls where well informed and helpful . so be ready to have fun

Reviews.Title: “wonderful boutique hotel..”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a small special boutique hotel located in a really nice section of Condado, Puerto Rico. It is just 3 short blocks from the beach and convenient stores, bakery and restaurants in the area. There is a Walgreens nearby, and panhandlers around there, but there is constant presence of police and security guards around the area. The room is spotless, fresh linens and towels, and amenities. You have to request a hairdryer from the front desk , but they do not ask for it back everyday. The bathroom, shower only, and toilet are very clean. The bed is very comfortable and they give extra pillows. Also, for some reason the airconditioner is not noisy. VERY NICE!!! The staff is very helpful, if within their means, of course. There is coffee by the front desk all day . I would say this is a fair value for the area, knowing that San Juan PR hotel prices are on the high side for the kind you might get. I would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1helpfultraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a cruise and our family of 5 stayed at this hotel. They have a family suite with 2 double beds and a sofa sleeper. It was a tight fit for 5, but it was only 1 nt. The beds were so comfortable, the room quiet and great a/c. Keep in mind it is the tropics, stuff warps, there is mildew, but the place was clean and in a great location. Right around the corner you have plenty of restaurants, shopping, a Walgreen's etc, then you are at the beach. Area is safe, so don't be troubled by bars on windows etc, it is Puerto Rico and private residences have security to deter crime. I would stay here again, suggest you book as far in advance as you can, it is a small hotel, but the price was less than anything else I could do on my own. I was concerned when I read other reviews, but having lived in the tropics, I felt many of the concerns raised by other reviewers were from people who never lived in a humid, tropic area.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: aznana2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 2 nights precruise. While it is not the Ritz we felt it was great value for what we paid. Although the rooms are small they were adequate. After all who wants to spend a lot of time in your room when your in San Juan??? The rooms were also clean. We would absolutely stay here again. The desk staff was great about recommending places to eat. They also talked us out of spending alot of $$$ on a taxi to old town and gave us easy instructions on how to catch the bus. My only recommendation would be not to get a ground floor in the front by the lobby. Our friends were in the first room off the lobby and they had to request to be moved after the first night it was so noisy. We were in the second room off the lobby and the second night we were there I was woken up at midnight by someone having a very loud discussion with the desk clerk. About 12:30 I finally got up and openned the door and asked them to please hold it down. They apologized and there was no further sounds from the lobby. Again just don't get a room near the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: madebymehae
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have found a better pick through expedia! I went to PR years ago and did all the touristy things. This time around I wanted to just relax enjoy the beach and mingle with the locals. This hotel is located in condado, which is an upscale neighborhood in san juan. The beach is literally around the corner, tons of cute boutiques, spas, louis vuitton, ferragamo, gucci, souvinier shops, great cheap & fine dining, the indian park is close by, a gym (this neighborhood doesn't mess around with their fitness) there's a runner going past you all the time! I can go on and on about the convenience of this hotel and location. There's a walgreens and bodegas so you can stock up on water and snacks. Ok the hotel is like a mom & pop boutique inn, in an upscale residential neighborhood. The rooms are very basic. Bed, tv, desk, bathroom, shower only no tub, the room smells a little when u walk in because of the humidity (not a dirty smell). What do u expect in 85 degree weather? Breakfast they have coffee downstairs (awesome), juice, packaged honey buns, boxed cereal, granola bars. It's free I never ate it because you can get amazing breakfast for under 5 bucks on ashford avenue. Also the B21 bus is 75 cents it takes to old san juan in 30 minutes. The bus stop is in front of the la concha hotel. This is the most excellent location for someone laid back and not picky. I can't wait to go back!!!!! Its also very safe!! Police men always around!!

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: finney_andrea
Reviews.Content: Despite the negative reviews of this hotel, we had a pleasant stay at Le Consulat. The hotel is in a great location for someone looking to explore San Juan. The beach is litterally 2-3 blocks away and there are tons of restaurants and shops very close to hotel. Bus stop was only a block away so very convienant if wanting to visit other parts of San Juan. The staff was amazing and we knew all their names by the end of our 4day stay. They really went out of thier way to be as helpful as possible. The frontdesk even moved us from the 2nd floor to a 1st floor room with a balcony/porch simply by requesting. Rooms were minimal but beds were very comfortable, more so than many hotels in the states. We've stayed in many foreign hotels, and got the best nights sleep that we've ever had traveling. Clean towels everyday, and even extras for the beach, upon request. For the money we paid, we couldn't have gotten a better deal. A lot of the negative reviews I read must have been from people expecting royal treatment and exquisite pampering because we felt that we got all we could expect, plus more from La Consulant. Location is great, service is good, and we really enjoyed ourselves. Great job consulant- Jerrid and Andrea ps-free breakfast is FREE breakfast. muffins coffee, and OJ was more than sufficient. Again, we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay When You're Looking to Explore”
Reviews.Author: Jolietian
Reviews.Content: First off let me say I was traveling with a very large group that was boarding a cruise ship the next day to attend a wedding. When we first checked in I noticed they were telling 2 other couples that they had overbooked and couldn't place them in a room. They then proceeded to get them a taxi and take care of paying for their rooms at another hotel down the street! Come to find out they were relocating some of the guests who weren't part of our party so that we could all stay together. Apparently we took up most of the hotel rooms. I thought that was very nice of them to ensure that none of our group got seperated and even tho they inconvienenced the others, they more than made up for it by paying for their new accomodations. When we entered our room I was quite surprised at how amazingly comfortable the beds looked. Unfortunately I can't give any feedback on them because I was designated to the pull out couch (which wasn't too bad). But I heard they were super comfy. The room was very clean and accomodated all 6 of us and our mounds and mounds of luggage nicely. The staff was super helpful in helping us find great spots to get a few drinks and some good eats! Even after our long night of delicioso margaritas at the bar behind the hotel the staff let us use the pool after hours. When one of my friends slipped and cut her leg the staff was more than helpful in providing first aid and making sure she was ok. They gave us directions to the nearest walgreens for some extra bandages and ice packs. The next day they let us store our luggage for the time between checkout and boarding the cruise ship while we explored the area. The only complaints I have about this place were the shower didn't have a warm temp...you either had really hot or really cold, the hot tub by the pool wasn't warm it was the same temp as the pool and the rooms don't really have any views except for the houses and businesses next door. Our group had a variety of ages from 18-70 & everyone loved their experience. I wouldn't suggest the area for children as it has more of a party atmosphere then a family one. The area seemed safe though and has a lot of shops and restaurants. Overall the hotel met my expectations and made my group very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, but far too little value for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: gbot00
Reviews.Content: I admit I was very disappointed (pissed actually) when I first saw my hotel room. The overall furniture was really really bad. The bathroom counter was particle board that had bad warping and separation and a miserable caulk job around the sink -- looked ready to be thrown out. I used tripadvisor to research this hotel, and I was a bit taken aback by how much shabbier the room was versus the photos I saw. The room was small and it had no view. The walls looked discolored. There is no lobby, this isn't even a "boutique" hotel as much as it almost feels like a pension bordering on hostel. The breakfast -- there isn't any. They do offer a muffin, but it's the kind of prepackaged long-shelf life muffin you'd get at a gas station. Now having said that, I will move on to the positives: The bed was absolutely comfortable and I slept very well. The linens smelled clean and were not dirty as some other people cautioned. The air conditioning, while a loud wall unit, did drown out street noise. I found the staff to be very friendly and super helpful, and their pool, while very small, was refreshing an in a nice, quiet courtyard. I hate dinging nice people, and I want to stress again I had very positive experiences with the staff, and the room was clean. But I simply felt that FOR WHAT I PAID (and I did book this through Delta vacations) I did not receive the value I was expecting. I feel that if I spent a little bit more money I could have stayed in a much more comfortable hotel with far more services. The simple matter is, Le Consulat is a one star hotel. And if they marketed themselves as a one star hotel, I wouldn't have been as surprised and probably more accommodating in my overall perception. But this was priced and presented like a 2/ 1/2 to 3 star which it simply is just not. Weird but really really minor note: Not even a notepad and paper in the room! I didn't even realize those things mattered until I actually found myself needing to write down info and had nothing to write on. The little things do matter sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has its good points”
Reviews.Author: Elsienette
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel, upon info from a friend it was a decent hotel. Let it first be understood I don't have high demands of what I need for a hotel stay. I need a clean room and clean bed and prefer to be in a quiet area/hotel. We were in room 106 at the rear of the hotel. The hotel is located within walking distance of many restaurants, a Walgreens a mom and pop grocery store, high end shopping as well as your run of the mill souvenir shops. The beach in Condado is about a 3 or 4 block walk. The room/bathroom, common areas (including the pool and hallways) and the patio area we chose with our room were all clean. I appreciated the fact they provided me with a muffin, coffee and orange juice in the morning because I expected nothing where that was concerned. I appreciated the fact that when we showed up 3 hrs prior to check in that we could leave our heavy bags and found them in our room when we properly checked in. They were also curteous enough to hold our bags after we checked out so we could enjoy more time before our afternoonflight home. I have gotten smart enough to bring ear plugs with me for sleeping purposes because no one can control if your neighbor wakes/keeps you up if you are a light/medium sleeper like me. I found the stay quiet for sleeping and was happy with the no frill price I paid and thought it was fair or above what we paid. I would definitely consider staying here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: siouxtw
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in San Juan for one night due to flight/ferry schedules. (We were on our way to Vieques for 2 weeks and this was the first time in 4 trips we had decided to try the ferry vs. island hopper planes.) LeConsulat is a funky mid-60s kind of place, in a neighborhood that seems to be getting rejuvenated. I was ready for a major disappointment, but --surprise to me from my husband!-- there was a lovely private patio outside of our room with two chaises and a little table and palm fronds providing shade! However, the only window was a tiny one in the bathroom, so getting natural light was tricky as there's no screen on the door. Without the patio, my claustrophobia would have kicked in: very small room, but big enough for our purposes for one night. We were in the very first room off the tiny lobby. We had no problems with noise (maybe we were just too tired!), even though the younger crowd (20s-30s) started going out for the evening at about 10:00PM. We never heard anyone come back in. Also, there seemed to be a jump-up (Friday night party with loud music, like in St. Lucia) nearby, but it was no bother. When in Vieques, we use 95% DEET -- and still get bites. (95% is not a typo!) Mosquitoes were really no problem at LeConsulat. I think I just rubbed a sheet of Bounce fabric softener on exposed skin for the evening. LeConsulat reminded me of a place I've stayed several times on Gov. Nichols Avenue near Burgundy Street, in New Orleans. It looks like nothing from the outside, but there's a courtyard at the rear with a small swimming pool, including a little waterfall. We considered using it, but it didn't seem all that clean: apparently, it had rained at some point, and there were leaves and insects in the pool (not a lot, but enough to make it less than enticing). Between the communal patio, French and louvered doors and being on the outskirts of where it's all "really happening", it reminded me of the outskirts of the French Quarter. My husband reconnoitered the neighborhood (he didn't listen to me, failing to bring any sandals and was already regretting it), while I hung out and read on the patio. It had been a long trip from Chicago and my sprained ankle and bad back were not happy. He checked out the beach and liked it, but said it's not like Vieques (well, nothing is) nor the beach in our town on Lake Michigan, and found some boutiques and a Walgreen's, at which he bought his sandals. He would've been up for going to the beach if I wanted to, but I was just too enervated after a long day traveling from Chicagoland, with my maladies. I just wanted to chill out and get into the "island mode." We are talking November in Chicago, and a way-too-cool summer. By the way, the art is most unique, such as a screen print of a handgun on the bathroom wall. Someone obviously picked out interesting pieces one by one, vs. "regular" hotel art that's all the same and bland. Upon our asking, the young man at the desk recommended the restaurant next door, Puerto Peru. OK, this is one of the very best restaurants ever, anywhere! It had been open only a month and the emphasis is on foods from Lima. I've had other Peurvian food and it was nothing like this. We ate outside on the lovely, comfortable deck with a view of the street and the other restaurants nearby: they were very crowded and loud, and there was a major police car presence, i.e., lots of police cars driving by with their lights flashing. Nothing really opens or gets going before 8:00PM, and we were ready for dinner at about 6:30PM. (Yes, that's remarkably early, but all we'd eaten all day had been over-priced airport junk and some stuff we had brought with us.) We had certainly made the right choice: the owner/our server recommended the ceviche as an appetizer and I wrinkled my nose. He said, "Oh, everyone says that until they try it. This is Lima-style." Well, my fish and seafood-hating husband ate way more than half! It was fabulous! After the ceviche and drinks, I signaled the owner: he thought we wanted our bill. No way! We wanted to order entrees. I had some kind of shrimp dish and my husband had some kind of chicken and we were each delighted! It was so gorgeous out, we decided to walk around the block before returning to LeConsulat. Big mistake: this must be one of the longest, biggest blocks anywhere! It's essentially a residential neighborhood with businesses on this block (well, 3 sides of it) and the block behind LeConsulat, across the street, closer to the beach. The side with LeConsulat is the "happening" side, with resturants, clubs and some stores. Then it gets "interesting" on the side behind LeConsulat: older (50+) women and young boys "working the street" -- quite blatantly. Funky (in a nasty way) bars and tee shirt shops, knick-knack stores with a couple of tatoo parlors and a designer boutique that actually looks expensive occupy that side. (All but the tatoo parlors and bars were closed by that time of the evening.) The fourth side is residential and construction. By then, my back and ankle had had it and making it back the long third side of the block and down the block to the LeConsulat (both residential) was torture: didn't think I'd make it, but no other choice. However, if you're in decent physical condition, this should be a snap! When we go Vieques next time, if we have to spend the night in San Juan, I'd consider it. You pay for what you get and with LeConsulat the price and accomodations were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: TrudieA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in Condado. You can walk to several restaurants and clubs located in the heart of Condado. The price is decent (for Puerto Rico); they have free parking in a lot nearby. Rooms are clean and big. My only complaint is that my room was on the first floor close to reception and the receptionist started to watch tv or listen to music loud and early in the morning. Breakfast is just coffee and muffins on a little table in the front so don't expect much of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, clean, comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: kimleeb1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise for one night. The neighborhood seems rather upscale with some nice homes nearby. The staff was pretty business like. The room was small, but functional, and included a 32 inch TV with lots of channels. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast included coffee and some packaged muffins, but it was free. Would stay here again, as it was an excellent value, and a good night's rest! Note: Our friends used an online site to find a cheaper price at a more expensive chain. However, their hotel was not in a good neighborhood. We were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place.”
Reviews.Author: LCDaMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a couple of blocks walk to Condado Beach, close to casinos, shopping, restaurants. Get a room on the main floor if possible, they come with outdoor patios. The hot water in the shower was hit-or-miss, for some reason, but that was a minor problem. The pool area is nice, and welcome after a hot day of hiking Old SJ. Overall, a nice place. Book through Choice Hotels website and pre-pay after joining Choice Advantage club for extra possible savings.

Reviews.Title: “Musty & Insects”
Reviews.Author: jess0099vp
Reviews.Content: We did not like this hotel. We noticed that the sheets were never changed during our stay (5nights of SANDY beach lounging) and the room was so damp and musty that it gave me a sore throat after sleeping there. That wasnt fun for our vacation. Worst of all, they never refilled our soap or shampoo. And when the room was "cleaned" our towels were simply picked off the floor and hung back up. Honestly, its Puerto RIco, those towels were sandy and gross and I cant believe we had to go down to the front desk anytime we wanted fresh towels and they were not just places in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet small, friendly & close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Skipaccess
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel in San Juan. The room was very comfortable & clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The small, private pool was perfect for relaxing. Also, the location is excellent, close to the beach, good restaurants and the bus line. The only negative was that the wireless internet did not work on our floor for our entire 5 night stay. It worked on other floors and in the pool area. This made it very frustrating trying to make and confirm reservations such as with the airline, etc. We were told by the staff that it was going to be fixed, but wasn't. All in all a good place for the price, at least in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Jrussell5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not only located in a good spot with food(subway, local restaurants, Wendys) and bars around the corner but was perfect for anyone traveling on a budget. I spent 5 nights here and each time room service came in each day to clean the room. The rooms are a little small but more than enough room for 2 travelers.(Stayed in a 1 bed room). The beds are comfortable and clean. The bathrooms are also very clean with a modern look. The staff was very friendly and let us print our boarding passes since we were late to getting to the airport. They have muffins and coffee served each morning which were nice to snack on before traveling to the national forest. The only downside was that the parking is located behind the hotel. Its not a deal breaker for the hotel, but needed information for anyone who is planning on staying here. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Small Treasure on Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Viajera048
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly through their website and thanks to the AAA discount, ended up with an incredibly low rate. My experience was so positive that I was ready to write my review upon arrival! Where can I start? The staff is so friendly that they stood on Magdalena Ave. after my check in to help me back up into upcoming traffic. The parking facility - which was my main concern- was excellent, just a few steps from the property. And, for some reason...they did not charge me for it! The parking staff is helpful, friendly, and they even carried my luggage to my car and placed it in the trunk my last day. I had to tip the employee-it was the decent thing to do.You walk a few steps and find yourself across La Concha Resort & Casino, plus dozens of eateries, small pubs, al fresco dining and small souvenir shops. This hotel provided me with the safety of a well traveled area - all I do in Puerto Rico is visit my Dad and Le Consulat is going to be my official headquarters.A walk towards the left takes you to Walgreen, and the beach. The room was on the small side -but larger than I expected based on the reviews I read. I only had one problem and it was with the hot water, but let me be clear: this will not affect my positive review or my return! The bathroom has a small heating unit under the sink, and I had only cold water my first 2 mornings. I think because everybody was using the showers at the same time and it happens in PR. But when I spoke to the front desk, they instructed me to set the heater higher , then when nothing happened... surprise, the faucets were basically crossed and the problem was solved. The atmosphere at this hotel is so pleasant, that I even hugged the housekeper when I left. I am a local,but they made me feel special and treated me as if I was a tourist. I am recommending this property to my sister and my nephews because they travel to the island for the same purpose, and we just need a clean, well located, simple, safe and efficient hotel.This is going to be my home away from home.After a long period trying a variety of hotels without success we have a winner, Thanks Le Consulat , I can't wait for next year.

Reviews.Title: “It was very family orient”
Reviews.Author: Steffy_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great... Very close to the beach... There were alot of resturants around.... The pool area was very good... The breakfast was small.. overall it was great.. My sister and myself enjoyed.....Very clean...

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great people, best hotel in San Juan region for the money”
Reviews.Author: RLCroot
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the cheapest place possible that wouldn't be painful, and based on reviews selected this hotel. I was incredibly pleasantly surprised. This isn't a resort, but it is a sweet, small (about 20 rooms), clean, comfortable place. Possible complaints: the rooms are small, there's only about 20 TV channels, and "breakfast" is some SaraLee muffins and orange juice. But for the budget traveler, this is luxurious - a great pool and hot tub, wonderful downy pillows, incredibly kind desk managers (who constantly anticipated and met our needs) in a fantastic location - five minutes walk to Condado Beach, and a short taxi or bus ride to Old San Juan. Make sure to get the internet prices - they're about half of the regular ones.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: nyc_vs
Reviews.Content: Decent stay for the price (booked through expedia for less than $100 a night).. But there are so many options around that I may not return here.. esp if I have the time to plan.. and here's why... Pros: - Reasonably priced - Good location - Almost free parking ($5 for entire stay) - Friendly staff - Free internet (though its not very fast) Cons: - Extreme water temperature in the shower... It was either hot or coldâ€¦ - Inconsistent housekeeping (for half our stay we were missing towels!) - No room key (since the plastic keys were not working, the desk person had to let us into our room each time... very inconvenient) - No breakfast as mentioned by other reviews.. Muffins and coffee in lobby

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: MattKelley
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel for those of you who want a place to sleep and relax between tours and excursions in Puerto Rico. The rooms are small, but clean, and the beds are very comfortable (we had 4 pillows, a comforter, a blanket and a throw on ours). We stayed in room 302, which had two windows but not much of a view (we didn't care much about the view, anyway). Our room had a flat screen TV against the wall opposite the bed (17 channels of basic cable, 4 of them spanish, the rest in english), a desk (with a lamp) a rolling office chair, an overstuffed easy chair (not a recliner though), and two end tables (one with a lamp). The floors were tile, and mopped daily by the maid. The only trouble we had with the room was that the first night we were there they had forgotten to give us wash cloths with our towels, but a quick trip to the desk solved that. Service was excellent, and the desk clerks (all of them) were extremely helpful in giving us directions and maps. they have a very small pool in the back of the hotel, but it is only big enough for a family or two, and we never did use it - with several incredible beaches within two blocks, it seemed kind of silly to go sit in the pool! The location is excellent, between Ashford and Magdelena streets (a half block before they come together on their west end), with plenty of restaurants, stores and the beach within a block or two of the hotel. There is a Walgreens a half block away, around the corner, and a 24 hour mini-mart diagonally across the street by the post office. Parking is available for hotel guests for a small fee (I paid $5 for the entire week we were there). The lot is behind the hotel, and you must walk about a half block around the corner to get to it from the hotel - but it's an easy walk and well lit. The lot is secure and well guarded at all times. There is a bus stop right around the corner ($0.75 per person to travel to/from Old San Juan), and a taxi stand that always has a few taxis waiting (day or night). All in all, this was a great little hotel for us to stay at while we ran around exploring Puerto Rico. If you are the kind of person who expects to spend a lot of time in a hotel (rooms service, fitness room, etc) then this is NOT your hotel. If you are looking for an economical place to sleep and use as a 'base' for your vacation travels, you really can't ask for a better location. We will definitely stay at Le Consulate the next time we come to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, boutique-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: philrick
Reviews.Content: Very cute, clean hotel in Condado, San Juan. You're just one block from the ocean and you have all the convenience of San Juan and Old San Juan. Be sure and use Kayak.com to find the cheapest price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two separate nights (arriving at 4 am the first time). The first room had a noisy air conditioner and was a bit dingy but we didn't do anything about it at 4am! Breakfast is a voucher for a local cafe. It's a bit of a walk for the food and coffee was great. Our second room was much better albeit it still a bit small. Although there's no place on Trip Advisor for reviews of car hire companies, I'd like to commend Charlie Car in San Juan. Their price was very good, the cars were fine and they had very useful shuttles to/from the airport and cruise port. At one stage, they let us leave our luggage at their office after we'd dropped off the car then took us to the airport several hours later when we'd been on a tour of the old town by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tleebell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 other couples for a day before our cruise out of San Juan. Easy to get a cab at the airport and pay the $15 cab ride (plus $1 per suitcase) to hotel. Staff was very helpful and never seem to get flustered or irritated with any questions or concerns. Rooms were on the small side but the bedding was so very comfortable. We spent most of our time in the Condado area or in the patio/pool area. The location of this hotel cannot be beat, with several shops (including walgreens), restaurants and bars right around the corner. Cab ride from hotel to port was $20 (plus $1 per suitcaise). We really LOVED the included breakfast at the bakery down the street......their coffee was EXCELLENT, and so was the ambience. This hotel provides a good location, decent amenities and superb customer service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place yo stay in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: Linleela325
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect after reading the reviews of Le Consulat but decided to book as the price was good and the location looked perfect. Very glad I did. I was surprised at the size of the room after reading complaints about the room being too small. Obviously these people never stayed in Manhattan or Paris! The room was more than large enough with a queen size bed, double closet, desk and desk chair and an easy chair. There was also a flat screen TV. My only complaint was that it did not have a dresser even though there was plenty of room for one, The bathroom was more than large enough. The location was great. We could walk to the beach -right in front of the Marriot - and use their bar for our pina coladas. There were plenty of restaurants and shopping near by. We never had to use a cab. On our last day we decided to rent a car to drive to the rainforest and then to the airport where we dropped off the car. We were able to rent it the night before as Le Consulat offered free overnight parking at a lot just around the corner. All in all I was very pleased with my choice and we not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - just don't expect much else”
Reviews.Author: serg94
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here 2 nights b4 going to old san juan for the remainder of our stay. The good - The location is great. just a short walk to Ashford Ave and the beach. Clean bathrooms. Good bed. The stay included a good coffee and pastry at a local cafe. The bad - tiles everywhere including the halls, which amplified any noises. I was awakened by the sound of someone rolling their luggage down the hall! Also, we had a room facing the street, which was quite busy with traffic. Dusty, at least on the TV. Stains on the bed sheets. Being this hotel is part of a national chain, it took away from the boutique-style that this place otherwise possesses. Staff was nice and helpful but ambivilant.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, but small”
Reviews.Author: alixw
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at this hotel and it was fine for the money. Our room was basic but clean, really all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel, Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: patriciochgo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of everything in San Juan, we enjoyed the location very much. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the room was a decent size. Only con was the air broke during our stay, the staff quickly moved us to another room so all was well. This is hotel is no frills but comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodations, if you don't intend to spend a lot of time at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Messer1170
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advantageously located in Condado; it's close to the fancy hotels and good restaurants, and it is a couple of blocks from the beach and the bus to Old San Juan. The price is reasonable - esp. when compared to nearby La Concha and Condado Plaza. We really enjoyed the pool, too, and pretty much had it to ourselves whenever we went in. That being said...there wasn't much else to recommend this place. Our room was tiny - and with our luggage it made for a really crowded space for us to walk around in. The air conditioning worked well, but the moldy smell mentioned by a previous reviewer was a constant presence for us as well. The bathroom was dated and the shower just didn't look as clean as it could have. After the first night there, we planned to re-use our towels, so we folded them up and put them back on the rack in the bathroom. But the housekeeper took ALL those towels anyway and then only gave us one clean towel and facecloth back for two people. We had to have the concierge go search for a few clean towels from empty rooms to give us. This place is in dire need of makeover but I'm sure it's making tons of money from people who need just somewhere to lay their head and clean up without dropping a ton of cash. If you plan to be out of the hotel much more than you're in it while in San Juan, then this is a good choice to save some money on accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled like a wet tent.”
Reviews.Author: JessandJor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the one not-so-great part of our trip. We had to switch rooms once because our room on the first floor was loud and smelled VERY strongly of musty mold/mildew. Very 'moist' in the rooms at all time. The place just never really felt clean at all. The worst thing they did was NEVER give us fresh towels or sheets (even after 4 nights, were they clean when we got there?). They literally picked up our dirty, sandy towels off the floor and folded them up and put them back on the towel rack. That is just unacceptable to me. We had to ask for fresh ones but God knows if they were actually clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: sawill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before heading to the Gran Melia in Rio Grande, and we couldn't have asked for more for the price. It's walking distance to all the bars, restuarants, shopping, the beach, and other larger, more posh/entertaining hotels in Condado. In fact, we spent most of our time at La Concha - ate at La Perla, had drinks on the patio several times, went to the beach, and visited the casino - but instead of paying $322/nt to stay at La Concha, we just walked around the corner, and got a great little room for less than $100/nt, including a small breakfast. The breakfast doesn't seem too exciting, but it provided more than enough fuel for both myself and my bf for a walk to Old San Juan (4ish miles). Overall, excellent, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Room 108: Outstanding value in the heart of the Condado neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: golfnbeachnut
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled to San Juan for a 5-day respite from the Michigan winter. Travelers included me, my wife, and 6 1/2 year old twins. We were looking for a good, solid, clean place to hang our hats while enjoying everything that San Juan and the surrounding area has to offer. We chose Le Consulat based on it's location in Condado near the beach, its affiliation with Choice International, the reviews we read on Trip Advisor, and the price. When we travel we look for hotels that offer a great value since we spend very little time there outside of sleeping. The room we stayed in could have slept six, which makes it an every better value. For $135/night we received: *two comfortable queen beds, *a spacious sitting area with a pull-out sofa, *a large shower (no bathtub), *a large closet adjacent to a desk/work area, *a new 42" Vizio LCD TV, *a large private patio (the only one in the hotel), *close proximity to the pool, which was never used, *a great location in the heart of Condado near numerous restaurants, nightlife, beach, post office, highway access, *free parking one block away in a 24-hour valet-attended lot, and *free daily breakfast vouchers for everyone in the room at a local bakery. Service The service was great. The staff was very attentive and helpful with local recommendations, especially when we had to take our son to the Ashford Hospital to treat his pink eye infection. The Room Room 108 is the best value in the entire hotel due to it's size, spaciousness, and private patio. The room was clean, but not fancy. The shower and bathroom were a bit dated, and the hot/cold water was a challenge, but we did not complain. The room has two windows and the sleeping area is somewhat separate from the bathroom area. The only drawback about the patio was the late night noises that crept through the metal non-insulated door. We only had a problem one night when a local dance party woke us up. Otherwise, the sounds of the coqui "tree frogs" might annoy some people. Location and Amenities The hotel location cannot be beaten. It's literally two blocks from the beach, a Walgreens/grocery, numerous high-end restaurants, and easy access to the highway. Parking and breakfast are included, which cuts down on costs significantly. Several people complained about the breakfast (more European/lighter fare than American), which we thought was adequate to get our days started. The vouchers allow you a choice of drink (juice or coffee), and a choice of pastry, ham/cheese croquette, or oatmeal. We supplemented the free choices with eggs & toast one day and pancakes on another for $5 each. The bakery is frequented daily by locals who convene to laugh, joke, and enjoy the good coffee and companionship with one another. A few of them chatted with us after recognizing that we had been visiting their morning gathering place for a few days in a row. Suggested Improvements We would recommend soundproofing the patio door in room 108, which would create a better sleeping experience. We would also suggest that the staff test the water heaters/pumps in each room prior to each guest's arrival. The shower temperature often fluctuated between very hot and very cold every few minutes. Travelers Who Should Stay at This Hotel Stay here if you are seeking a great value without the over-the-top Ritz-like service and amenities. If you are looking to simply use your hotel as a place to rest and sleep and you want great value, Le Consulat is the place for you. If you want a big resort-like feel with extravagant surroundings and amenities, then you might consider La Concha a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here, unless you don't mind roaches and loud noise at night.”
Reviews.Author: amyn13
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks cute from the outside, but the rooms are not clean- there was hair all over the shower, the fixtures in the bathroom were rusty and some were broken. On our last day in the room, we saw a roach. The pool is tiny. We left San Juan for a few days to go to Vieques and checked back in to Le Consulat (only because we had already booked it and didn't want to lose money by canceling our reservation) for a couple days before flying home. This time when we checked in, the man at the front desk was completely rude. He put us in a different room this time- one that was just next to the front desk. We didn't sleep all night because there was constant talking at the front desk and the phone was ringing a lot. That morning, we spoke with who we assumed to be the mgr, a very nice woman, who said we weren't supposed to be in that room and she didn't know why the guy had put us in that one. She gave us a new room that was again dirty, but fine enough to spend our last night. The only good things I can say about the hotel are that the one woman is very friendly and gave us directions to the bus and nearby restaurants. She also called taxis for us. Each morning, you get a voucher for a coffee and tiny pastry at a cafe up the street. The hotel is in a great location- near the beaches, a bus that takes you to Old San Juan and several shops and restaurants. However, there are so many hotels in the area, I would do some research and choose another.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: xjazz20x
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect a grand hotel, but I definitely expected some amenities- quiet, clean, smells good (or at least no smells!!) From the outside, the hotel looks pretty okay...but you can already see that it is hanging on by a thread. Shortcuts were made, and it seems apparently that they were also made within the hotel. The lady that was at the reception was really nice, but run down. She said she had already been there for 8 hours- we got there at 12 pm! In any case, our room was not ready, and I also wanted to have a room in the back of the hotel and not on the first floor to avoid any "noises" as others had mentioned. We got a room on the third floor in the middle of the hotel instead. It looks more like an apartment building from the inside... The room- it smelled when we got there, like some cleaner that was used to clean the room. We tried to open the windows, but then bugs were flying in, so we had to close them. Luckily, I had a body spray, that doubled as an air spray (for us anyway), and it helped. Sheets were all stained, as were the towels. The shower was not clean....both my boyfriend and I wore flip flops to take showers. The shelf in the shower was rusted, as was the toilet paper holder....so i actually used a hanger to hang my loofah! We didn't use the closet because as we were looking around the room, and I opened the closet door, it became unhinged! Yikes! Also didn't use the safe, as they charge for it?? and it didn't seem very safe. We were there for only 1 night, but I didn't realize how bad it was. The air conditioner was very noisy all night, and there were pipes in the wall or something, and were very loud, and would go off. It sounded like someone next door was taking a shower, but they might have been pipes to go up to the 4th floor? Also, we didn't get any breakfast vouchers as others had mentioned, and when we asked, they didn't have towels for the beach! Odd, since the website says they have an outdoor pool!! I only booked this hotel as a post-cruise night, and this was the only hotel I could find that wasn't $300 for 1 night. If I had known it would be this bad, I would have either tried something on priceline.com or just forked over the extra money.....

Reviews.Title: “Save more&spend less,Free parking,breakfast,wifi.Good deal”
Reviews.Author: LutfyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I was here on Dec.31-1/09. 2 adults. Great value for short time. Great penny pinching for your money. The rooms are small, & comfortable. No 5 star hotel, but i give it a 3 star. The only negative is the cleanness of the floors. Yes the room 304 air cond. was working perfectly. You need that here. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: aaronmelissa1108
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Located in the middle of tourist area, Condado -Friendly daytime staff Cons: -The location of room 112 (and possibly other rooms on the first floor) -Loud evening staff -No window in room -Small "flood" that was not cleaned up

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: lolastravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel for a week long stay in San Juan. The location is great because you are right in the middle of Condado, and you are walking distance from tons of restaurants, stores (all the way from Gucci and Cartier to the typical souvenier shops), and the beach is right around the corner. There are several bus stops if you don't rent a car, but if you do, you get free parking in a lot right around the corner. You also get complimentary breakfast vouchers for a cute bakery down the street. The people that work there- the desk and housekeeping- are all really nice and friendly. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: eetonaee
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Le Consulat late in the evening but because it is located close to clubs and restaurants we still got to enjoy some San Juan night life. We were upgraded to room 108 on the main floor. It had a bedroom, separate seating area and large bathroom. It is right next to the door to the pool. Room was clean and comfortable. As we were leaving for a cruise the next afternoon they let us keep our bags in another room at no charge while we went to the beach and did some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel near old town, good food, and transportation”
Reviews.Author: gbofly
Reviews.Content: We did enjoy staying here in the heart of Condado in June especially because we felt safe enough to walk around leisurely and due to the abundance of shops and restaurants nearby. Surprising quiet too -- Our room was closer to Magdalena Ave (away from Ashford) so that may have helped. The breakfast voucher program whereby you walk to a nearby deli for breakfast worked well. It's proximity to Old Town made for an enjoyable - though sweaty - day long walking tour there. Staff was very accomodating - getting us a good room, printing boarding passes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, location; poor management, don't rent room 112”
Reviews.Author: jdkv
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The first night we were in room 112. The next day we asked to be moved because of noise at the front desk and small lobby. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accomodating. Our 2nd night was spent in a room down the hall from the front desk, looking out at the pool. Great room, very quiet however, hot water did not exist and there were ants in the room. We spoke with the desk, the clerk apologized and offered to move us again. We said no, could she please contact the manager to get someone to repair the hot water and take care of the ants. She did that for us. We came back later that night and the hot water was not repaired and the ants were still there. I asked to speak with the manager. She gave me his number. I called and he said, he gave the clerk the authority to move our room. I told him we did not want to move again. He said he would call the clerk to give us a discount. Later that night the clerk told us she would credit us 50% of that nights room rate. Ok a cold shower isn't that bad especially since we were sun burned. The 3rd night it rained very hard...came into the hotel at 1 am, clerk had the door locked so we couldn't get in. He finally opened the door and said he was mopping up a flood in the main hallway near our room. Yes you guessed it, water got into our room. The clerk was mopping, throwing towels down and very apologetic. We helped with the clean up. We now go to bed after 2 am. The day of check out I wanted to speak to the manager about our not so good stay. The clerk called him and he told the clerk he would not speak to us and that he already discounted one night and that he was sorry for what happened. Never once did the manager Dagoberto Gonzalez ever come to the hotel(he is a resident manager of the Howard Johnsons nearby). This hotel has potential! We will not return or recommend until that manager is replaced. A complaint was filed with Choice Hotels International. The employees are wonderful at the hotel however we have a feeling that thye are not treated well by the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: stellastar78
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful in providing directions to other places on the island. It offers free parking a block away and a free breakfast at a nearby cafe. The first floor rooms were bigger than the other rooms and had a private terrace, but not for light sleepers because of the noise at the front desk and front door. We had to switch rooms the second night we were there. The rooms have air conditioning, TV and a hair dryer. There is also a pool, which we never used. We really liked the location, in Condado, which had a lot of restaurants and bars and was a block from the ocean. It was conveniently located by the highway, so we were able to get to different areas quickly. No dance clubs nearby, driving or taxi distance. Good value, less than $100 a night, and the breakfast and parking was a great bonus. We did have a problem with the showers, they were either really hot or really cold. That was the only downside. Overall, we really liked the place a lot and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, simple, great service and well situated”
Reviews.Author: jaynehernando
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are someone who is not looking for a hotel with luxurious rooms and amenities. It is very simple and very clean, perfect for someone who does not spend a lot of time at the hotel. Service was great! all the ladies were very nice, the night we checked in there was an older gentleman who was grumpy but we never saw him again. Condado is a very central location, be-careful taxi drivers will try to charge you $15 but if you manage to catch one in the street you can negotiate up to $10 - $12 to go to Old San Juan. The complimentary breakfast is basic, don't expect a buffet, it is at a nearby deli type restaurant that is also very clean. The receptionists were very helpful in suggesting places to visit without having to take and expensive tour. They have a small pool in the back, it seemed clean but since the beach was only a 2 min walk away I preferred the beach instead. Walgreens is right around the corner also! They have the cheepest parking in the area! it is around the corner from the hotel. However I would suggest not to rent a car unless you are going out of the city, since it is very crowded and expensive to find parking. If I were to go to PR again I am definitely staying at Le Consulat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings - Good Price but not much more”
Reviews.Author: robcamacho
Reviews.Content: Well, we needed a place to stay for two nights prior to our Cruise on Carnival's Victory and originally booked the Ritz-Carlton but based on reviews from travel advisor I decided to change my reservation to place that wasnt as pricey as the Ritz. While the location of Consulat is pretty good it is still a decent taxi ride away from the Cruise port and Old San Juan where all the action is. Based on some of the reviews I thought it would be a lot closer. Taxi's charge between 12-22 USD to get to Old San Juan so over the two days we ended up spending roughly $100. We would have been better served to stay in Old San Juan. Other than the location the hotel does need a little facelift - the showers had a little mildew and the floors needed a good cleaning. The AC unit was WAY loud, normally me and wife can sleep through a storm but this AC kept us up all night. Not sure why we didnt complain until the end of our stay.... If you are looking for a cheap, no frills hotel just to sleep this would be OK If you are looking for a pre or post cruise hotel I would look at the Sharaton in Old San Juan. It is beautiful and right on the port so you can walk to your cruise ship (Carnival anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Fabulas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited here in March 2008. I was reluctant to stay here based on some not so great reviews, but boy was surprised. The place was newely renovated, which felt like a new hotel. The rooms were small, but if I wanted to spend lots of time in the hotel, I'd have stayed in a resort. The best thing about this hotel was the location. It was about a 5 minute walk to the public transportation (buses) that were top notch. For 75 cent each way, you can go all over San Juan and Old San Juan safely. Another thing that was great about this hotel is the breakfast voucher to a resturant (Pelyato or something like that). This was a really nice way to start our day and made for an even greater experience. Free wifi was also a huge plus! I would most definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: dau
Reviews.Content: My husband and teenage son stayed one night prior to our cruise. Our large room was having AC problems so the hotel had arranged for two rooms for us across the hall. The location was convenient to the beach and large hotels and casinos if we wished. The girl at the desk was very helpful in recommending a "local" spot around the corner for dinner. Although the rooms were small they were more than adequate and the AC worked without fail. They also accommodated us the next day by allowing us to move to one room for late check out and arranging a cab to the cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal before and after cruise”
Reviews.Author: newkruzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our cruise and also for one night after our cruise and found it perfect for that purpose. The deciding factor in choosing it was their ability to put our entire family of five in one room, saving us the cost of a second room. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly, the pool was cool and refreshing, if not a little small, and the location is ideal, near the beach and a huge selection of restaurants. Our only issue was that on our pre-cruise night, the air conditioner shut itself off during the middle of the night and we all slept fitfully after that. Our second stay, we figured out how to work the A/C and all was well. If you're a family traveling with luggage, plan on a $20-$25 taxi fare from the airport and a similar fare to the cruise terminals. I wouldn't make this hotel the centerpiece of a long stay in San Juan, but for a couple of nights with a family of five, it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms that sleep 6, but no parking and no pool?”
Reviews.Author: MaynaRios
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location in Condado. It was not on the beach but the walk was very short. We were traveling with 6 people and wanted an affordable stay in Condado. We were able to get a room here with all 6 in one room (2 double beds and a pull out sofa). The room was small but nice, with it's own patio and flat screen TV. The bathroom wasn't the greatest, with terrible water pressure, which seems to be an issue all over the island. Overall, the hotel was pleasant and very quiet. Two things we were a bit upset by : First, the hotel advertises a pool, one reason we chose it. During our stay the pool was out of service, and in fact, was not even filled with water! Second, there is no parking to speak of. You can park at a nearby lot for $10 a night, but it's a strange valet situation. Since we had a rental car we were a little leary of leaving our keys, but we had no choice and it turned out fine after all. Beware of the free breakfast since you have to walk to a nearby cafe and you get approx 3 oz. coffee and an empanadilla. Overall though, it was a nice place and we'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Showing Wear & Tear; Little Hot Water & Water Pressure; Paper-thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: soleil17
Reviews.Content: Booked Le Consulat as a last-minute option based on Trip Advisor reviews. The good: lower price than nearby hotels, one block away from bus route that takes you to old San Juan; friendly staff; Clean white duvet covers. Free wireless internet was the major perk. The bad: There was very little water pressure, I had a hard time even getting all the shampoo out of my hair. The water that was there was either luke warm or cold, temperature is supposed to be controlled by a guage located under the sink - the system clearly does not work correctly. The walls are paper-thin and we could hear every last noise in the hallway, as well as ringing telephones in neighboring rooms. The air conditioner worked very well on full strength, but was very noisy and did not work well if you didn't want it on full blast. Only one chair in our room, meaning that one of us had to sit on the bed if we wanted to spend time in our room while planning our day. The bathroom and hallways are looking very frayed around the edges, and also looked like they could use a good scrub. I wouldn't stay here again unless I had to to save money - in the end, it wasn't worth the $50 we saved by not staying in a nicer hotel closer to or in old San Juan (if that is your destination)/

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LorieNem
Reviews.Content: We flew into San Juan a day before our cruise left and stayed here. We absolutely loved it! It is not the Ritz, but has everything you need and is very clean. We took a taxi from the airport for $19 to get here. We were expecting to have to leave our luggage and wait for a room (we arrived @ 11am), but they have a room available. The room was very modern and clean. It also had a very large private patio attached to our room. The hotel price includes breakfast @ Pelayo, which is just a block or so down the road. Some reviews did not like the breakfast, but we LOVED it!!! You choose a pastry and a drink, I chose a cinnamon roll and coffee (which was actually a latte). It was so good, wish we discovered this restaurant around lunch/dinner the day before. There is also a Walgreens nearby we frequented to get sodas to take on the boat. The beach is only one block away, we just went on the side of the La Concha Hotel. We caught the local bus in front of the La Concha which took us to Old San Juan, only about 15 min. away. The bus was only 50cents much more affordable than taxi prices. All and all though it was a great bargin, clean, central location, we definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cutesy”
Reviews.Author: tpalacio
Reviews.Content: Le Consulat was very cute and humbling. The hotel is centrical to EVERYTHING: a bus ride or cab drive to Viejo San Juan (Old San Juan), all of the lively clubs, restaurants and SHOPPING. Maria and the staff were great! We were upgraded to a room with our own patio, which was so darling. Staying in LE CONSULAT allowed me to blend in with the locals, more so than with the tourists. Everyone was so friendly and i really felt the true boricua experience. I recommend this hotel for young 20 something travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tropicalteacher
Reviews.Content: If you want a small intimate feel to a hotel, and not the sterile cookie cutter approach, then Le Consulat might be the one for you. I opted to stay there this week right after I had surgery on my elbow and my stay was quite pleasant. The staff at the front desk was helpful and pleasant. My room, #108, right next to the pool, was a suite with a couch and chairs, as well as two queen sized comfortable beds. The little patio outside the room was private and cute. I loved the location, as we were right in the Condado, among all the happenings of the larger hotels, on a busline, important if you want an inexpensive ($.75) way to get around, and close to restaurants and 24/7 Walgreen's. The area is safe, well lit, and neither my adult daughter (29) nor I (63) were afraid walking real early in the morning nor after 10pm at night. The voucher given for breakfast, a three minute walk away at a local bakery/restaurant, was quite nice. You had your choice of yummy spiced oatmeal, Danish pastries, local toasted bread, and a choice of coffee, hot chocolate, bottled water, or juice. We returned there in the evening for sandwiches........try the Media Noche, or if you are super hungry, the Cubano. We had both and we enjoyed them very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: BikeArlington
Reviews.Content: Overall, very satisfied with Le Consulat. Upon arrival, seeing that we had brought our daughter with us, the desk clerk upgraded us to a larger room (two queens and sofa sleeper) for the first three nights of our four night stay at the same price. Nice! This was Room #314 and we liked it very much. The final night was in #310, which was still nice but definitely smaller. Regarding previous postings about noise, we had no problems with noise on the third floor. Also, the hotel is located on more of a side street which reduces overall noise. Pool was a huge plus for our young daughter -- it is a small pool but nice and clean. I felt very comfortable walking around the area at night -- going to Walgreens or nearby Internet cafe. My wife did not feel comfortable alone, however. The breakfast at a local restaurant is good, though we always supplemented it with additional food -- was still a good deal. As other posters have mentioned, staff was very good and helpful. If the staff is inviting friends to hang out in the evenings, as noted in previous reviews, I hope that stops. We did not notice anything like that, however. Parking is do-able, but you may have to search nearby streets for a space. Sometime you get lucky and get a spot on the same street as hotel and sometimes you don't. Rent a small car and brush up on your parallel parking!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price and what we needed”
Reviews.Author: hemea
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night pre-cruise. Price was right as we didn't need a resort coming in late afternoon on rainy day. Location is great, near beach, Walgreens, shopping and several restaurants (we went to Buenes Ayres down block for drinks). I would agree with previous posters abour our room, #112, right off lobby. Does get noisy in evening, with people and computer TV. Door to patio has no glass or screen, one window in bath does give it a cell-like feel. It was very clean and bedding was good. Spent most of evening out on patio or by pool to be out of room. Area was safe as far as I could tell and we did some walking after dark. Some residences and another hotel several doors down. Ice is down hall, no mini fridge. Maria? at front desk was very helpful calling taxis and sending us in right direction to stores/food. Okay for 1-2 nights, just specify room other than #112 if you are light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for one night!”
Reviews.Author: knitter06
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise. Hotel was very clean, staff helpful. We had a room on the 1st floor which had no window- but did have a lovely private patio. Unfortunately, the patio doors had no way to let in light unless they were open. The room was small, but had a nice flat screen TV. The cafe for breakfast was delightful. The pool area looked very pleasant. It is in a convenient location- we had dinner at Miro, a block away, and enjoyed it. It was a good choice for our purposes, even though it was quite basic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Gimikgirl
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to the Condado we selected Le Consulat becasue of location and price. We were not disappointed. Suzette, Janet and Nadia were FANTASTIC...helpful, friendly and professonal. The hotel is CLEAN and chic. It is simple and basic but really charming. We enjoyed the pool, had our own private patio. Room decor is charming. Location could not be better...tons of great restaurants nearby...beach is two blocks away where you can rent a chair for $3.00! (near the Marriott -can also rent at La Conch for $5 for the whole day) Breakfast was really cool because they now send you down the street to Panaderia Pelaya, a hip little local bakery-cafe-restaurant with an outside deck on which to enjoy your cafe con leche and people watch!
