Each morning we then took a little stroll down the street and around the Condado lagoon. Couldn't have been nicer. If you go, don't miss the mojitos and salsa music at Yerba Buena just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Boutique Hotel; Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: DrBus
Reviews.Content: I agree with the recent 2009 reviews. This is indeed a fantastic "boutique hotel" in a very convenient, safe and comfortable section of the Condado (halfway between the International airport and Old San Juan). As the other reviewers have stated, a 24- hour Walgreens is no more than two blocks away (around the corner) and there are many decent walking-distance (i.e. 1-3 blocks) restaurants in the neighborhood. The beach is no more than three blocks away. Rooms were charmingly appointed with tasteful tile floors and a flat-screen T.V. Coffee maker in the room as well as a hair dryer. The staff was extremely responsive and caring ...both day and night shifts! We had a small problem with an air conditioner and we were shifted to a different room within minutes. They exhibit great pride in their property and value their customers. A great value. I can now see why both business and leisure travelers were impressed wit this hotel; it "earns" the positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Was worried but Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sevenklub
Reviews.Content: Before arriving to the hotel I was nervous about reviews and no one knowing about this hotel. It was a great location, very clean, simple but nice. Free Wifi, Great Staff, literally two blocks away from beach, one block away from ashford ave strip. Walgreens is around the corner. Did I say how great the staff was? The only problem we had was the airport taxi did not know where the hotel was located. (that scared us.) He called the hotel and got the location. Every other taxi driver in condado and old san juan knew EXACTLY of the location. If you are wanting to save money and your looking for a clean place with basic amenities then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “It was a little above average...Could be great”
Reviews.Author: Mannywood
Reviews.Content: I arrived here during the third week of February for a 4 night stay. I chose this hotel based on previous reviews and the excellent room rate as I was traveling with 2 guests and needed a large room for a reasonable price. This hotel delivered. I made the mistake of not renting a car until the third day we were in San Juan because I thought parking would be a problem, but it's actually rather plentiful near the hotel and if you don't get lucky enough to find free parking on the street (I did both nights), the lot at Dunkin Donuts only costs $10. Taxis are crazy expensive on the island (what else is new in the Caribbean)? The staff was moderately friendly (some much better than others) and housekeeping was fairly attentive. Nothing special, but worth the price. The beach was right around the corner, along with a Walgreen's that we visited several times. The rooms at Le Consulat do not have a coffee maker, refrigerator, or blender, all of which would make this a much more enjoyable place to stay given the crazy expensive prices of food and drink on the island. That being said, the drinks are STRONG and the food was outstanding everywhere we ate.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaptain_Morgan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel several months in advance and without having any photos to see of it. But it offered one room for the 4 of us (Mom, Dad, 22 yr old Daughter and 19 yr old son) to stay in. Son took sofa bed. Only complaint here is the bed didn't have any sheets. We improvised by using the comforters from both queen size beds. We stayed the night before our cruise. The area has lots of restaurants and is about 2-3 blocks from the sea. Room was clean and farily spacious, when the sofa bed was closed. No complaints on cleanliness. The breakfast, which I had already known was small, was actually more than I thought. You can get danish, pastry, 2 croquettes or 2 pasties, a bowl of oatmeal, or toast with butter. And you can have coffee, juice, water, or hot chocolate. And they have more you can buy. And the service gets an A+ because I lost my wallet in the taxi that brought us from the hotel to the cruise pier. A call to the hotel desk got the clerk to call the taxi and arrange to drop it off back at the pier. Due to some communication issues and being swept up in the boarding procedure, the taxi driver had to make 2 trips back as I wasn't down front the first time. Both the clerk and the driver went out of their way to help keep my vacation from being ruined by my inattentiveness.

Reviews.Title: “A dirty room in not the best part of town with a rude evening desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: Carrezando
Reviews.Content: Room had used Q tips on the floor, hair on the floor in the bathroom, no towel bar, no soap dish, no hot water, broken pool, no on site continental breakfast (had to walk to a restaurant with a chit for a very basic "choose two-one from each column", no place for luggage... no delayed checkout or offer of place to put luggage until time to go to cruise. Not an easy walk to better hotels except for Marriot. NO LONGER PART OF CLARION... it is now independent...no place ot complain!

Reviews.Title: “A”
Reviews.Author: CRUISERTN
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night pre and one night post cruise and booked it based on the TripAdvisor reviews. This is a very small, very basic hotel, that only has a bed, night stands, TV and one chair. No dresser, no mirrors except the one in the bathroom and a large close up mirror in the bathroom that was rusty. Very disorganized on check out mornings on weekends before a cruise, and when cruisers are returning post cruise. Check out time is 11AM and they would not give an extension for another hour, so you have everyone in an 8 ft. x 8 ft. lobby trying to check out and those coming from a cruise trying to check in all at the same time, and luggage everywhere and no secure place to store it. On the return post cruise, we arrived at 10:30AM and no rooms are available until 3pm. They opened a room for everyone to store their luggage but it was not secure, and my husband ended up having to carry a HUGE camera bag and all of his camera equipment around with him into Old San Juan because of not having a secure storage place. It is very convenient to get the bus for 75 cents into Old San Juan. Make sure you have coins only. Wendy's and Walgreens right around the corner, and staff was helpful. When taking taxis from the hotel to the port and from the hotel to the airport, the hotel staff called the taxis for us and they were prompt; however, since the rates were not regulated by the taxi stands and we were not given a paper with the written price, both taxi drivers charged $5 to $8 more from the start as they made up their prices as they went along, so be prepared.....many taxi drivers did not know the location of the hotel, but just tell them on Magdelena Ave, right around the corner from La Concha hotel. I agree with a previous post that the rates should be in the $80 price range for such a basic hotel. Two small plastic cups provided in the room and ice located only on the first floor. Not many amenities and we skipped the "breakfast" because of the bad reviews it received. I would stay at this hotel again since it seems to have a good price for the location. It would be a lot better if they allowed for a 12 Noon or 1PM check out and at least have a secure place for luggage to be stored when coming or going. I would recommend the hotel only if you know in advance and are OK with a place that is VERY small and VERY, VERY basic. Another note: the designer stores in the area on Ashford Avenue such as Louis Vuitton, Cartier, etc. are all closed on Sundays. The shops in Old San Juan are open from 11AM to 5PM on Sundays. Another note: The queen beds are very small and if possible try to get a bed with two queens; they do not have king size beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre- and post-cruising stay”
Reviews.Author: southguy
Reviews.Content: Very clean nice little hotel. Affordable. Restaurants, convenience stores and Wallgreen within a 5 minute walk. Very convenient for pre- and post-cruising. Well located, right between the Cruise Ship Terminal and Airport. The staff is fantastic FROM THE FRONT DESK TO MAID AND POOL ATTENDANT). Polite, helpful and welcoming. WOW! Honestly, we were sad to leave. We loved the pool area. Feeling at home. Quiet and peaceful. Wish we could speak Spanish as well as they speak English and a litlle French. We loved the place and those extremely nice people. From the Hotel, it's easy to get to Old San Juan by bus for 0.75 (exact change). Bus stop nearby. Taxi with 3 or 4 luggages is about $20 from Cruiseship to hotel or from Airport to Hotel and vice versa. It varied from $19 to $21 with Turistico Taxis. A two dollar tip is very much appreciated, but they are not waiting for it. This hotel is not a Resort with numerous facilities, but it's the best you can get considering the price, location and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “The jury is still out - Amazing personnel... EXCEPTIONAL Manager!”
Reviews.Author: DreamyOahu
Reviews.Content: OK... I found out about this hotel on this Website. Yes, I was looking for the BEST price... with a high standard. Le Consulat is a Clarion Hotel connection. Not sure what that means... however, Clarion is shielded on the wall behind the Front-Office personnel. That noted, I was surprise at what appears to be a hotel which is not well organized. OKâ€¦ letâ€™s start with the good stuff. The outer appearance is very nice. The staff are delightful, very nice. The manager, Janice an absolute doll and genuine! Natalie, superior; Alexis, professional; Gabriella, sweet Joseu, thoughtful, considerate and very bright. Simply quality in the hotel as far as the employees. The problem isâ€¦ the hotel is too small for the demand. Thatâ€™s the problem. Too many people want to stay at this new hotel in the Condado area. They donâ€™t have sufficient cleaning people to keep up with the ridiculous demand. What I have discovered is San Juan, Condado area is a port city clearinghouse for cruise ship travelers and therefore makes it very demanding on hotel personnel to continue to rotate people in and out of rooms everyday for God sake. If they can somehow, get better cleaning staff, a place to store luggage, electrical outlets in the lobby for people who must wait four (4) hours for their room to be ready, and if they can change their check out time to 12:00 instead of 11:00 a.m. which is way too early, and if they can dump their "so call" breakfast provider who provide that ??? continental breakfast which is horrible, and if they can do a great job scrubbing the floors, and the bathroom shower floors and walls well because of all the traffic in and out and in and out and in out of there and if they can do a better job of quality control on laudry, towels ectâ€¦ they will be and do just fine. Location is ideal! Smack in the middle of EVERYTHIG! Price should be around U$80.00 â€“ 125.00 max/night including the tax. Their prices are way too high for only a basic room without a refrigerator or water or breakfast. They are too expensive! They must bring their rates down if they intend to hold on. Do I recommend this hotel, yes, I do without reservation because the staff are willing to make up, pick up the slack where the room, inefficiencies, and sundries are taxing on travelers. I am confident that they will be making drastic improvements in future because the employees are aware of their challenges and the necessity to employ changes and enhancements.

Reviews.Title: “Looooooved Le Consulat Service Staff....”
Reviews.Author: Xiomy25
Reviews.Content: They only semi-confusing thing that I will say about the hotel is that I guess it's changing it's name from Clarion Collection Le Consulat to Clarion Ascend Le Consulat, so it was a little confusing to find it but that should be solved pretty soon... But as far as my stay there let me tell you that it was nothing less than outstanding. The rooms are exremely clean and spacious, it's located almost right on the main strip which makes it great because you're close to everything but not right in the middle of everything so you get your privacy while being in a great location. The Front Desk Staff was awesome, I was checked-in by Leiza (I might've spelled it wrong, sorry!) but she was so helpful with all the questions I had as far as where to eat and where to go so I was really pleased with her service. The other person that helped my there was Joshua, he set up the tours I wanted to go (which I loved), told me the right places to go shopping (loved the mall I was at), and also recomended me a great place to go eat some great puertorican food and listen to some local music, so thatks to you to!!! All and all I had a great time in Puerto Rico shopping and going on tours, but staying at this hotel really made it all go so much smoothly so thank you very much if you read this!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Consulat for one night prior to our cruise from San Juan. I booked this hotel for two reasons: 1-The hotels in SJ can be very expensive, and this one was quite reasonable ($119). 2-The reviews I read on tripadvisor were good. II have nothing bad to say about the hotel at all. It is a boutique hotel, so the services are limited, and the rooms are small. However, the room was spotless, and the bed was comfortable. Newly renovated, the decor in the rooms is quite modern. There's a flatscreen TV in the room, which is nice, as is the large closet (should you need one). I also liked the fact that there was a safe in the room. The hotel is in a GREAT location in Condado. The beach is a few blocks away, as are restaurants, stores, bars, and more. The gal who manned the desk when we checked in at night was great and gave us a lot of information about restaurants and stores in the area. Because we stayed at the Marriott (which is about 2 blocks away) a few years ago, I knew that there was a Starbucks very close and that there was a good pizza place nearby, also. Another big plus, by the way, is the fact that there is free wireless internet service available in the rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Consulat, Ascend Collection Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1149 Magdalena Ave Condado, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
